DOC.brief_summary: It is presumed that families of poorly controlled diabetic adolescents (type 1) would benefit from parents' counselling, guided by "the New Authority" model.
DOC.brief_title: Applying the "New Authority" Model in the Treatment of Poorly Controlled Diabetic Adolescents and Their Families
DOC.detailed_description: "The New Authority" model has been shown to be helpful in risk behaviors such as children's violence and school refusal. It is assumed the model would prove helpful in the risk behavior of lack of adherence to diabetes treatment regimen. The treatment is give to parents only, without the adolescent's participation. It is predicted to improve self care, parents' monitoring, family conflict and parents' helplessness.
DOC.criteria: diagnosis of diabetes type 1 condition duration a year or more family does not speak Hebrew adolescent doesn't live at home serious psychiatric condition in the family
